intro: Chrysosplenium carnosulum, commonly known as the fleshy spleenwort, is a member of the Saxifragaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often arranged in a rosette. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-white in color, and appear in clusters. Chrysosplenium carnosulum is known for its ability to thrive in humid conditions and is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
